Class Serializator

java.lang.Object
com.battleship.models.Serializator
public class Serializator extends Object
Utility class responsible for saving and loading the game state.

This class belongs to the Model layer and provides persistence functionality using Java serialization and a complementary plain text file.

Two files are used:

  • battleship_data.ser: stores serialized Java objects (Board instances and elapsed time).
  • battleship_status.txt: stores human-readable metadata such as nickname and elapsed time.

This dual approach allows:

  • Reliable restoration of complex objects via serialization.
  • Easy inspection/debugging of basic game information.

  • Method Details

    • saveGame

      public static boolean saveGame(Board playerBoard, Board enemyBoard, String nickname, int timeSeconds)
      Saves the current game state to disk.

      The method performs two actions:

      1. Serializes the player board, enemy board, and elapsed time into "battleship_data.ser".
      2. Writes a plain text summary (nickname, shots fired, elapsed time) into "battleship_status.txt".
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board
      enemyBoard - the enemy's board
      nickname - the player's nickname
      timeSeconds - elapsed game time in seconds
      Returns:
      true if the save operation completed successfully; false otherwise

    • loadGame

      public static GameDTO loadGame()
      Loads a previously saved game state from disk.

      The method attempts to:

      1. Deserialize the player board, enemy board, and elapsed time from "battleship_data.ser".
      2. Read the player's nickname from "battleship_status.txt".
      Returns:
      a GameDTO containing the restored game state, or null if loading fails or files are missing/corrupted
